alert.note: Alert for Carbon; Monroe (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 3:42AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...ELEVATED RISK OF WILDFIRE SPREAD TODAY... Relative humidity values are forecast to drop into the 20 to 30 percent range from late this morning into early this evening in the Pocono Region of Pennsylvania and in far northern New Jersey. A southwest wind is expected to increase to 10 to 15 MPH with gusts of 20 to 25 MPH. The anticipated weather conditions in combination with the recent stretch of dry weather will result in an elevated risk for the spread of wildfires today. Use extra caution if handling any potential ignition source, such as machinery, or cigarettes and matches. Be sure to properly discard all smoking materials. Any dry grasses, dead leaves, or other tree litter that ignite will have the potential to spread fire quickly. For more information about wildfire danger, burn restrictions, and wildfire prevention and eduction, please visit your state`s forestry or environmental protection website.
